Authors:
Anna Berthe Ralaiveloarisoa, Kare Liimatainen, Tuula
Niskanen
Title:
Gloeocantharellus andasibensis sp. nov. (Gomphaceae) from
Madagascar
Keywords:
Fungi, Gomphales, morphology, gloeoplerous hyphae,
ITS
Abstract:
Gloeocantharellus andasibensis sp. nov. is recognized by
having orange red basidiomata, innately fibrillose, viscid pileus,
ellipsoid to amygdaliform, verrucose basidiospores, and a distinct nrITS
sequence. This discovery forms the first record of the genus from
Madagascar. To improve the understanding of the nomenclature of the
genus, the type specimen of G. okapaensis and a specimen of G.
lateritius and G. cornerii accessioned in the fungarium of the Royal
Botanic Gardens, Kew were also sequenced.
